snyk_findings.title: Arbitrary Code Execution in Apache Commons Text (Text4Shell)
snyk_findings.description: Apache Commons Text 1.5 through 1.9 is vulnerable to remote code execution via variable interpolation. An attacker can execute arbitrary code by crafting malicious input that triggers script execution.
snyk_findings.remediation: Upgrade flink-streaming-java to version that uses commons-text 1.10.0 or later

snyk_findings.title: Denial of Service in Jackson Databind
snyk_findings.description: Jackson-databind is vulnerable to denial of service via deeply nested objects causing stack overflow.

snyk_findings.title: HTTP Request Smuggling in Netty
snyk_findings.description: Netty is vulnerable to HTTP request smuggling attacks due to improper handling of Transfer-Encoding headers.

wiz_findings.title: Azure Storage Account Key Exposed
wiz_findings.description: Azure Storage account access key is exposed in application configuration. This key provides full access to all blobs, files, queues, and tables in the storage account containing customer event data.
wiz_findings.remediation: Rotate storage account keys immediately, use Azure Key Vault for secret management, and implement Managed Identity for authentication

wiz_findings.title: Network Security Group Allows Unrestricted Kafka Access
wiz_findings.description: Network Security Group allows inbound traffic to Kafka brokers (port 9092) from any source (0.0.0.0/0). This exposes Kafka cluster to internet-based attacks.
wiz_findings.remediation: Restrict NSG rules to allow Kafka access only from authorized IP ranges or VNets

wiz_findings.title: Kafka Topic Without Authentication
wiz_findings.description: Kafka topic 'customer-events' is configured with PLAINTEXT protocol without SASL authentication. Any client can connect and consume sensitive customer event data.
wiz_findings.remediation: Enable SASL/SCRAM or SASL/PLAIN authentication on Kafka brokers and configure ACLs for topic access

wiz_findings.title: Kafka Encryption at Rest Not Enabled
wiz_findings.description: Kafka topics containing sensitive customer data do not have encryption at rest enabled. Data is stored in plaintext on broker disks.
wiz_findings.remediation: Enable encryption at rest for Kafka log segments using Azure Disk Encryption or Kafka native encryption

wiz_findings.title: Schema Registry API Without Authentication
wiz_findings.description: Confluent Schema Registry API is accessible without authentication, allowing unauthorized users to view and modify schemas.
wiz_findings.remediation: Enable authentication on Schema Registry using basic auth or RBAC
